revised_title: Modernization and Automation in Shipbuilding: A 1972 Perspective
tldr: This article discusses the modernization and automation of the shipbuilding industry in the 1970s, focusing on the Japanese shipbuilding industry. It highlights the significance of modernization in improving productivity, reducing costs, and contributing to the growth of the global economy. The article also examines the main features of modernization, such as securing capable employees, advanced technology, and cooperation with related industries. It provides an overview of the history of modernization in the Japanese shipbuilding industry and the trends in investments made by major Japanese shipbuilders. The article also explores the development of automation and labor-saving techniques in the shipbuilding process and the potential for further automation in the future.
